p: Garlic essential oil was more toxic than asafoetida essential oil with Cx. restuans larvae being more sensitive to both oils compared to Cx. pipiens larvae ( Table 3; Fig. 1). The LC 50 values for garlic and asafoetida essential oils against Cx. pipiens larvae were 7.5 and 13.5 ppm, respectively, while the LC 50 values for Cx. restuans larvae were 2.7 ppm for garlic essential oil and 10.1 ppm for asafoetida essential oil ( Table 3). Allyl disulfide was also highly toxic to larvae of both mosquito species (LC 50, Cx. pipiens = 12.5 ppm, Cx. restuans = 9.4 ppm), suggesting its important contribution to overall toxicity of both oils. The cotoxicity coefficient values were 80.3% for Cx. pipiens and 46.9% for Cx. Restuans, suggesting that the two oils interacted antagonistically.
